description: Canonical definitions for Spark-related concepts and development terms across agent workflows.

terms.definition: AI entity with memory, tools, and defined behavior used to accomplish complex tasks via workflow orchestration.
Declarative workflow composed of multiple steps or subtasks. Not to be confused with background job runners like Celery tasks.
Runtime instance of a Task, potentially stateful and trackable across sessions or replays.
Function or external capability callable by an Agent (e.g., web search, file system, browser, code interpreter).
Conversation context window containing memory, user interactions, and agent responses. Can be stateful across turns.
Single interaction within a session—either a user prompt or agent response. Forms atomic units of session history.
Inline comment marked with `AIDEV-NOTE:`, `AIDEV-TODO:`, or `AIDEV-QUESTION:` for signaling intent, concern, or complexity to developers or agents.
Cognitive pattern (Chain, Tree, Graph, Filtration) used to structure Spark’s thinking and output formation based on mode and task type.
Product Requirements Document—a structured markdown artifact describing the goals, features, risks, and acceptance criteria of a system component.
Configuration setting controlling verbosity, reasoning depth, and framework selection. Includes `lite`, `standard`, and `pro` tiers.
